text.p: The following are the leading stories in the Maltese press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- EU officials due today to discuss Euro-Mediterranean conference. The delegation, led by Dutch Foreign Minister Hans van Mierlo, is also visiting Algeria, Tunisia and Egypt as part of preparations for the second Euro-Med conference to be held in Malta on April 15 and 16.
- Malta marks Freedom Day, recalling closure of the British military base on the island on March 31, 1979.
- Hunter injured when his dog triggers off shotgun left resting against a wall.
- Government delay in introducing new tax system of customs and excise duties to replace Value Added Tax will cause further uncertainty.
